What is Pax Silica and why does India joining the US-led AI coalition matter
description: India signed the Pax Silica declaration at the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi on Friday, formally joining a US-led coalition aimed at securing global supply chains for critical minerals and AI infrastructure. The alliance—already counting Japan, Australia, South Korea, and the UK among its members—seeks to reduce dependence on China, which controls over 90 percent of India's rare earth imports. Membership could accelerate India's semiconductor and AI ambitions significantly.

title: New labour codes: From layoff guidelines to timely wages; checklist issued for employers

Simply speak in your language, and it's instantly understood in another. This government-developed tool makes conversations effortless, connecting people across diverse linguistic regions.

Investigations often lead to dead ends due to encrypted tunnels, no-log policies of VPN providers, and international privacy laws, leaving authorities in a reactive loop.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer blocks Donald Trump from using RAF bases for potential Iran strike

The consulting giant is also tracking individual weekly logins to its AI tools. The move follows CEO Julie Sweet's earlier warning that non-adapters would be "exited." Internally, some employees have pushed back, calling the tools "broken slop generators." The policy comes as Accenture's share price has fallen roughly 42% over the past year.

title: Erik Karlsson says Sweden came to Olympics to face the US
description: Sweden's dominant 5-1 victory over Latvia has propelled them into a quarterfinal showdown with the undefeated United States at Milano Cortina. Key offensive performances from Zibanejad, Nylander, and Landeskog, coupled with Lucas Raymond's record-breaking assists, showcased Sweden's newfound chemistry. This win sets the stage for a crucial elimination game against their American rivals.

title: NBA trade news: Warriors sign $60M Celtics big, skip Giannis chase
description: The Golden State Warriors have acquired Kristaps Porzingis from the Atlanta Hawks, trading away Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield. This move aims to bolster the frontcourt and scoring after Jimmy Butler's season-ending injury. While Porzingis offers valuable spacing and shooting, his durability remains a significant concern for the team's playoff aspirations.

title: Kashmir scientists develop wheat varieties to solve crop cycle issue
description: Wheat is sown in October and typically harvested in early summer; in Kashmir, however, where rice is the dominant kharif crop, the timing is critical: farmers need to vacate their fields by May-June to transplant paddy; if wheat stays in the field until June, the rice-wheat rotation breaks down
